data.event: The county was formed in 1820 and named for Colonel John Grant, who led a party of settlers in 1779 to establish Grant's Station, in today's Bourbon County, Kentucky.

event.title: led a party of settlers in 1779

data.event: The county was formed in 1820 and named for Colonel John Grant, who led a party of settlers in 1779 to establish Grant's Station, in today's Bourbon County, Kentucky.
The Grant County News, established in 1906 and published in Williamstown, is preserved on microfilm by the University of Kentucky Libraries.
Grant County was established in 1820 from land taken from Pendleton County.
The present courthouse, built in 1939, replaced two earlier structures.
